means: 严厉的责骂、批评或惩罚

sentence.Network_en: Some people believe that work is a better means of order and discipline than chain and castigation.
sentence.Network_cn: 有些人认为要使犯人遵纪守法劳动是比镣铐和惩罚更有效的手段.

PerfectNetExp.abs: letter:signature=playbill:castcastigation n. 申斥，强烈反对to subject to severe punishment, reproof, or criti.
castigate v．惩治，严责castigation n．申斥，强烈反对cataclysm n．剧变，灾难（常指大洪水或地震）.
castigate v.谴责;惩治 [L castigare reprove<castus pure castigation 强烈申斥;反对;鞭打;惩罚] casualty n.意外;灾祸 [ME<medL casualitas(CASUAL), after.

list.abs: 鞭的解释 | 鞭... ... [ flog lash castigate thrash ] 用鞭子抽打 [ thrash flog lash whip ] 用鞭子抽打.
lady , don't photocopy any more.Otherwise , you may get castigations .小姐，不要在影印了，你会得到报应的!

when they castigate an English-language newspaper in Shanghai for publishing " rumors " about mines the Yangtze River , they are asserting the rights of power against the individual right .当他们申斥上海一家英文报纸发表长江内有水雷的“谣言”时，他们是在使用政权的力量反对个人权利。
the remark was a Labour Party spokesman to castigate the Government for this attempt , which , in Labour's opinion is bound to lead to disaster .这个评语是工党发言人用来严厉批评政府的这个企图，这一企图在工党看来是肯定要引向灾难的。

entry.def: If you castigate someone or something, you speak to them angrily or criticize them severely.

example.ex: Marx never lost an opportunity to castigate colonialism...
example.tran: 马克思抓住每一个机会严厉谴责殖民主义。

example.ex: She castigated him for having no intellectual interests.
example.tran: 她斥责他没有智识兴趣。

auth_sentence.content: Wall Street and the debt ratings agencies have come in for well-deserved castigation.
auth_sentence.res_content: Wall Street and the debt ratings agencies have come in for well-deserved castigation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Wall Street and the debt ratings agencies have come in for well-deserved castigation.

auth_sentence.content: "There was always the threat of excommunication, lack of approval, castigation," he told me.
auth_sentence.res_content: "There was always the threat of excommunication, lack of approval, castigation," he told me.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "There was always the threat of excommunication, lack of approval, castigation," he told me.

sentences.en: Some people believe that work is a better means of order and discipline than chain and castigation.
sentences.cn: 有些人认为要使犯人遵纪守法劳动是比镣铐和惩罚更有效的手段。
